title: Hong Kong deploys 3 robotic ‘water-pumping dragons’ to drain 24 floods
summary: Hong Kong authorities have deployed for the first time three “mobile powerful pumping robots” to drain at least 24 flooded locations on a day when the city’s forecaster recorded the heaviest daily rainfall for August since 1884. According to the Drainage Services Department, multiple pumping robots,
fullContent: Hong Kong authorities have deployed for the first time three “mobile powerful pumping robots” to drain at least 24 flooded locations on a day when the city’s forecaster recorded the heaviest daily rainfall for August since 1884. According to the Drainage Services Department, multiple pumping robots, including three known as “water-pumping dragons” in Chinese, tackled the floods on Tuesday in Pok Fu Lam, Mid-Levels, Admiralty, Kwun Tong, Sha Tin, Sai Kung, Tai Po, Tolo Harbour, Tsuen Wan, and...
